speaker: Clearing
lines: Ferns tilt as if listening; the understory holds its breath.
Midges halo a stump carved flat by years of rain.
A scarf hangs on a branch and moves though the air is still.
The air tastes of mint and old fire.
A ring of stones marks a place someone thought important.
Someone left three berries on a flat rock: two red, one dark.
A root crosses the dirt like a line; perhaps a warning, perhaps a welcome.
Your name sounds different when you try it under these leaves.

choices.text: Sit on the stump and listen back.
Take a berry you think is safe.
